title: Michael Sheen shows off Chris Tarrant impression ahead of Millionaire drama
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Michael Sheen has demonstrated why he was cast as Chris Tarrant for an upcoming drama through his impersonation prowess.

The 50-year-old actor will play the former Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? host in new ITV drama Quiz, centred around the Charles Ingram coughing scandal in 2001.

Appearing on Sky One show There’s Something About Movies, host Alan Carr was left questioning why Michael had shaved off his splendid beard.

In response, Michael said: ‘It’s for the part I’m playing at the moment.

‘I’m playing Chris Tarrant in a series about, do you remember the coughing major on Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? Very controversial.’

Chris Tarrant was the host of Who Wants To Be A Millionaire before Jeremy Clarkson (Picture: Karwai Tang/WireImage)

Pressed by Alan to give his best impression, Michael offered a glimpse at what to expect – and it remarkably captures his mannerisms perfectly.

‘That’s amazing,’ Alan Carr said.

The show will chart the renowned scandal which saw Charles and wife Diana, alongside their pal Tecwen Whittock, win the £1 million jackpot after coughing from the audience on the right answer.

Charles Ingram will be played by Matthew McFadyen (Picture: Rex; Getty)

The case went to trial where Ingram, his wife and Whittock were all convicted by a majority verdict of ‘procuring the execution of a valuable security by deception’ in 2003, and given suspended prison sentences for two years and each fined £15,000.

Matthew McFadyen will play the disgraced contestant in the drama, with Fleabag’s Sian Clifford playing his wife. Helen McCrory will play Sonia Woodley who defended the Ingram’s at the trial.

There’s Something About Movies airs on Sky One and NOW TV Thursdays at 9pm.
